channel.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
channel.description: I have been looking at this mod since its beginning and bought the PCGAMER magazine with the original article explaining the premise of this mod! Since then I have been poking in and out of this forum and have been wondering what people are most looking forward to staying exactly the same with little change to the original. And what would you have liked to see changed completely or is there a big feature you would want to see implemented that would never be available in this mod, your choice!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: fury
item.description:
The multiplayer.

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: MrFob
item.description:
The sound of the 9mm. I mean, all the weapons sounds really but the 9mm is most important. IMO it;s the most badass pistol sound in any game I ever played.
There is probably material out there to see how it is but I refrained from watching any material lately to avoid spoilers, etc. Still, I hope they kept the sounds as much/close as possible.

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: Smat
item.description:
OrderOfDagon:

Definitely the part in Surface Tension when you come out of the gutter to the side of the mountain and see the Jets fly by…

That’s the part I was going to mention as well.
By the way, how cool is it that Ross Scott just released Freeman’s Mind #44 three days ago where he passes that spot?
I’d say pretty cool…

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: Joe_Freeman
item.description:
I would also like the grunts to stay as badass as they were in HL, with their cold and husky voices, and their black humor. I guess I can’t just kill them if they aren’t evil.

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: Harry-UK
item.description:
As long as the Imps are still brown and spikey and the Pinky Demons pink, I’ll be happy.

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: Joe_Freeman
item.description:
Questionable ethics is the only part I want to stay true to the original. And maybe Inbound, but not everything.

And the less, I guess it would be Surface tension, Blast pit or We’ve got hostiles.

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: Sergeant_Guthrie
item.description:
The blue screen of death at the begining of anomalous materials.

The part where the scientist tries to pull another scientist out of a vent and they both get sucked into it.

The daredevil scientist who leaps out of his office.

The guard saying “catch me later I’ll buy you a beer”

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: jessiestorm88
item.description:
I actually hope there’s a lot of new passages and different ways to get from point A to point B. One of the best things about the original was that you could watch videos of someone else play after you had beaten the game ten times and still see something that you didn’t know about.

I am excited to play the game normal the first few times and then start trying to speed run it and find all kinds of crazy shortcuts and glitches etc. exploring every aspect of the mod.

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: Kaminski
item.description:
The “eerie factory” feel to Residue Processing, and the puzzle elements in it. I just love the relative non-combat elements working alongside the overall feel.

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: Llewen_Ebag
item.description:
On a Rail. I love me some identical tunnels alright.

Seriously though, I kinda just want to play it. See what they kept true to the original and what changed. Maybe the dark empty feeling of Office Complex. Or the chaotic feeling of Surface Tension.

Read full topic

item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
I hope they keep some of the iconic lines exactly how they were in the original. “Why do we all have to wear these ridiculous ties?” “Science team…you think he was responsible; sabotage, maybe?”, “So, where are we taking this Freeman guy?”, “I didn’t sign on for this shit. Monsters, sure, but civilians?”, and so on.

Other lines are fine to be added, but I hope these lines from the original are in.

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
I mean, I did have an idea of remastering all the HL1 weapon sounds, and maybe even re-scoring the original music to match the timing of the new tracks. The thing is, if I do that, I’m going to wait until there’s been enough time for most people to have put at least two playthroughs into the mod.

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: Problematic_A-hole
item.description:
Xman:

I don’t understand why some of you want to replace the new sounds with the original ones. First of all, I know almost all of you won’t even bother doing that when it comes out. Would you seriously, before even playing the game, replace the sound files? That just sounds completely asinine.

Maybe that’s something you’d do on a second playthrough…maybe.

Back on topic though, stuff like the zombie in the chair having a seizure at the computer screen, all of the G-man appearances, zombie pulling security guard into vent, scientist diving through glass window, alien grunt throwing soldier through concrete wall, etc.

There’s idiots for everything, so Black Mesa won’t be an exception

Read full topic
item.source: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: Navitas
item.description:
I’ll happily play with the new sound effects, although there’s just something about HL1’s crunchy gravel and clangy crowbar that I’ll never forget…

Read full topic

Back on topic though, stuff like the zombie in the chair having a seizure at the computer screen, all of the G-man appearances, zombie pulling security guard into vent, scientist diving through glass window, alien grunt throwing soldier through concrete wall, etc.

item.title: What part of Black Mesa do you want to stay most true to the original!
item.dc:creator: King_Kaddo
item.description:
You will forget about Half life after you have played the mod. It will raise your knowledge and perception of game development and design so much that you will never want to see Half life again.
